We're working on more stories right now

Inside the House leadership scramble.

                Texas GOP Rep. Jeb Hensarling will not run for any leadership position. | AP Photo

            By 
John Bresnahan

09/28/15 11:40 AM EDT
Texas GOP Rep. Jeb Hensarling will not run for any leadership position but will instead back Rep. Tom Price's (R-Ga.) bid for majority leader, a Hensarling aide said on Monday.
Hensarling, who was in leadership, is currently chairman of the Financial Services Committee and a high-profile conservative.
"After prayerful consideration, Chairman Hensarling is not a candidate for a leadership position. He will support Chairman Price for Majority Leader," said Sarah Rozier, Hensarling's communications director.
Hensarling's move to support Price is a blow to both Reps. Steve Scalise (R-La.) and Cathy McMorris Rodgers (R-Wash.), who are both running for majority leader.
 © 2015 POLITICO LLC
description: Texas Repubican will not seek any leadership post
title: Hensarling backs Price for majority leader
orgs: American Coalition for Clean Cal Electricity
